a.title: Generic representation of the formulation administered to a subject that includes one or more specific antigen(s) aimed at developing an immune response in an individual to provide protection from a vaccine preventable disease(s). E.g. Generic description of the vaccine/Vaccine component(s) Example: J07BX03 covid-19 vaccines (temporary code, to be implemented in ATC 2022) 1119349007 | COVID-19 mRNA vaccine | 1119305005 | COVID-19 antigen vaccine |

a.title: Legend for this format

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: When the immunization was first captured in the subject's record
Source of information regarding the reported immunization event.
Provides the status of the immunization event, i.e., was the vaccine dose administered?
Indicates the reason the immunization event was not performed.
Indicates the reason the immunization event was performed.
The disease that the vaccination provides protection against.

Generic representation of the formulation administered to a subject that includes one or more specific antigen(s) aimed at developing an immune response in an individual to provide protection from a vaccine preventable disease(s). E.g. Generic description of the vaccine/Vaccine component(s) Example: J07BX03 covid-19 vaccines (temporary code, to be implemented in ATC 2022) 1119349007 | COVID-19 mRNA vaccine | 1119305005 | COVID-19 antigen vaccine |
Person that have or should have been vaccinated

A product that have or should have been administered to a subject that includes one or more specific antigen(s) aimed at developing an immune response in an individual to provide protection from a vaccine preventable disease(s).
Immunization Administration
The date the immunization was administered to the person.
The date the immunization was administered to the person.
A flag to indicate the recorded date of the immunization was estimated.
Quantity of the dose administered; (e.g., influenza dose is 0.25 or 0.5).
Route by which the immunizing agent is administered to the body (intramuscular injection, subcutaneous injection, oral, etc.).
The set of body locations to or through which an immunizing agent may be administered.
Health Professional responsible for administering the vaccine or prophylaxis
Administering centre or a health authority responsible for the vaccination event
Where the vaccine has or should have been administrated
The protocol (set of recommendations) being followed by the provider who administered the dose.
Dose Number
Series Dose Number
Vaccination series complete
Adverse Reaction
A flag to identify an adverse reaction was reported following administration of a vaccine.
Reaction date
Reaction detail
Additional information relevant to the immunization record.
Subject's immunization forecast
The date the subject's immunization forecast was generated
The date provided in the subject's immunization forecast.
Type of immunization forecast date; based on the immunization forecast types.
The date provided in the subject's immunization forecast.
Represents the subject's requirement for a particular Administrable Immunizing Agent.
